availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Yancy Eaker (Graves County, Kentucky, postmaster, student, and farmer)

body.p: Graves County, Kentucky, postmaster, student, and farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Martha Eugenia Haslem Eaker. Father of John Eaker, May Eaker, Lilly Eaker, and Rosa Eaker. Postmaster for Leander in Graves County from December 10, 1849, to May 27, 1850. Cadet at the United States Military Academy in Orange County, New York, from 1850 to 1854. Resident of Graves County in 1857. Farmer in Graves County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Graves County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994035, Graves County Births.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, Records of the Post Office Department, NARA Series M841, RG 28, Graves County, Kentucky, vol. 14, p. 620.
U.S. Military Academy Cadet Application Papers, 1805-1866, No. 22, 1849-1850; NARA Series M688, RG 94.
Register of Cadet Applications, 1819-67, Vol. 1850, File 078-161; NARA Series M2037, RG 94.
Official Register of the Officers and cadets of the U.S. Military Academy (West Point, 1887), 25.
